1. What is inside a PC system?

The nerve center of a PC is the processor, also called the CPU, or central processing unit. This is built into a single chip which executes program instructions and coordinates. The activities that take place within the computer system. The chip itself is a small piece of silicon with a complex electrical circuit called integrated circuit.
